review_blob: Pours brown with white head. Aroma is the very intense diacetyl, which covers everything. Some sourness with low bitterness with dry finish.

Pours haz brown with thin tanned head. Aroma: plums, caramel and cherries in chocolate. Taste is medium sweet with fruits flavours. Alcohol taste isnt very strong. It;s medium bodied with average carbonation. Very nice dubbel.
Very nice and extremly refreshing beer. Pours straw-pale and hazy with frothy head. Aroma is very tropical - bananas, citrus and sweet fruits. Medium bodied with lively carbonation.
Very nice example of dark lager but a little bit different than regular schwarzbiers. Aroma is more roasted, something like stout.

Pours deep brown with tanned frothy head. Aroma firstly offers some cereals and bread, then roasted malts and dark chocolate and finally caramel. Light bodied (to low for this style) with nearly flat carbonation. Taste is medium-high sweet with lots of sourness and too low bitterness.

Aroma firstky gives tones of roasted malts, caramel, dark chocolate and coffee but as it becomes warmer something like solvents shows up. Pours deep black with quickly disappearing head. Taste is mainly caramel and dark chocolate with medium-low bitterness. Its thin bodied with soft carbonation and abrupt finish. Unfortunately I didnt found nuts neither in aroma nor in taste.

Pours black with beautiful, frothy white head. Aroma: citrus, sweet fruits, roasted sunflower seeds and cocoa. Bitterness is high and sweetness is medium, theres also taste of dark chocolate. Full bodied withlow carbonation, oily texture and bitter finish.

I tried it twice and the first time was outstanding but the second time wasnt so great but i will rate like during the first time. Pours hazy amber with thick white head. Great aroma full of citrus, tropical and white sweet fruits - very refreshing. Great balance of medium-high bitterness and low sweetness. Full bodied with average carbonation. Very refreshing. One of best APA i tried.
Pours black with thin and tanned head. Aroma: citrus, caramel and roasted seeds. Full bodied with averag carbonation. Medium-low bitterness. Very nice.

Great beer! Pours deep black with beautiful frothy head which lasts for a long time. Aroma: milk chocolate, fuggles hops, something like milk coffee with sugar. Oily and full bodied texture with low carbonation. Although aroma is sweet, taste is well balanced of medium sweetness and bitterness.

Nelson Sauvin single hop pale ale. Purs clear gold with white frothy head. Aroma is like gooseberry, grapes and something more-hard to describe (plastic?). Taste is balanced between sourness, low sweetness and medium bitterness. Lively carbonation and medium bodied texture makes it very drinkable.
Pours hazy, light amber with thin but solid white head. Great aroma of mosaic hop-tons of mango, citrus and some other sweet, tropical fruits. Full bodied with high but great bitterness.
Complex aroma full of bread, nuts, citrus and herbs. Pours amber with average, white head. Medium bitterness with notes of cereals and citrus. Average carbonation, medium bodied and very refreshing.

Rich aroma with banana and clove. Light brown, hazy color with frothy tanned head. Full bodied with oily texture and lively carbonation. Medium bitterness well balanced with medium sweetness. Worth trying!
Aroma: plums, grapes and unfortunately something like medicaments... Purs deep amber with minimal white head. Its verry sweet and bitterness is almost none. Medium bodied with average carbonation.
Aroma: citrus, tropical fruits and butter? Hazy amber color with frothy head. Medium sweetness and bitterness. Oily texture withy bitter finish.
Aroma: porto, raisins and cherries. Pours very dark and hazy brown with thin tanned head. Medium sweetness, low bitterness and sourness. Tastes like Madeira. Medium bodied with low carbonation.
Aroma: apples and alcohol. Pours clear gold with nice white, frothy head. Its very sweet, low-bitter with strong alcohol finish. Medium-high carbonation, medium bodied.
Great aroma: citrus, herbs, sweet fruits and herbs. Pours hazy amber with frothy white head. Medium sweetness and high bitterness. Average carbonation and thick texture. Great rye ipa.

Very interesting combination of milk stout and chili peppers. It has very strong milk chocolate aroma. Pours black with frothy but thin head. Taste is very complex: high sweetness and milk chocolate flavour combined with hot flavour of several types of chili peppers and low but nice bitterness. Carbonation is very nearly flat. Texture is creamy and it;s full bodied.

Single hop Oktawia pale ale which shows big potential of new polish hop. Pours amber and hazy with thin but nice head. Aroma is mostly sweet fruits (apricots and melon) and floral. Sweetness is low, bitterness is medium. Its medium bodied with low carbonation and bitter finish.

Aroma: citrus, caramel and sweet fruits - rich but not too intense. Appearance: Beautiful hazy red colour and frothy tanned head. Taste: medium sweetness and high bitterness - bery well balanced. Smooth and full bodied with average carbonation and bitter-sweet finish.

Aroma: alcohol, peaches (like from belgian yeast) and some bread and cereal. Pours clear gold with rich and white head whoch disappears quickly. Taste is mainly cereal with quite high sweetness and low bitterness with strong alcohol aftertaste. Medium bodied with high carbonation (CO2 bubbles pinches in the mouth). In my opinion very good beer, not for fast drinking. It has clear lager character and tastes like very good stron pale lager. CO2 is maybe to high.
Aroma: citrus, pine and later white fruits. Colour is something between amber nad gold. Head is white and frothy. Medium carbonation, fully bodied. High bitterness. Simply very good single hop IPA.
Aroma: sweet fruits and some citrus. Pours dark brown with great and frothy head. Carbonation is medium. Nice bitterness combined with typical dubbel taste.

Aroma: sweet fruits, citrus, mango and this white thing from grapefruit :) Pale, light yellow colour with nice but quickly disappearing head. Taste is very nice bitter-sweet mix with higher bitterness at aftertaste. Average carbonation. Simply, great beer!
I cant tell the differences between Tiger Crystal and Tiger Lager Beer :). Generally non-aroma, yellow beer with high carbonation made for drinking during hot das because its quite refreshing.

Typical international lager. Weak aroma with some citrus. Light gold color with high carbonation and extremly quickly disappearing head. Good when youre very thirsty during hot day. Not a perfect beer but resembles great moments during holiday in Singapore :)

Great example of red rye IPA. First of all great label. Aroma is complex of citrus, sweet fruits, strawberries and some nuts. Clear red colour with frothy white head. Medium carbonation, thick texture. Taste is a perfect balance of high biterness, lew sweetness and american hops aroma. Worth trying!
Aroma: grapefruit, citrus and mango and other sweet fruits. Nice head but disappeared quickly. A little bit too low carbonation.

Aroma: peaches, bananas and clove. When its getting warmer solvent aroma comes out. Clear gold color with white and frothy head. Malty medium sweet taste with a little mango and alcohol. Bitterness is medium-low. Spicy finish and aftertaste. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Quite refreshing.
Excellent example of DIPA. Pours orange and hazy with thin but creamy head. Great aroma of American hops - like hoppy sirup. Taste is balance between sweetnes and bitterness.
Aroma: very dark chocolate and plums. Colour is dark brown, nearly black with beautiful head. Taste is like a sweet aromatized coffee. Definitely worth trying.
Very well balanced smoky bock beer with nice bitterness as a counterbalance to swetness from malts. Aroma: bread and wood-smoke. Taste is malty with caramel flavours.

This red ale with polish hops gives extraordinary aroma nearly like american hops beer. Aroma is full of citrus, grass, pine and herbs. Taste is something like biscuit with nice bitterness. Definitely worth trying.
Aroma is mainly citrus, pine, and "white fruits". Texture is nearly thick with low carbonation. Taste is combination of very high bitterness and light sweetness.
Great example of AIPA, probably the best in Poland. Aroma is full of citrus, grass and fruits. Taste is excellent balance of high bitterness and malt sweetness. Definitly worth trying.
Its really double chocolate milk stout. Aroma is full of sweet milk-chocolate. Its full bodied with rich and bitter-sweet taste. Its really worth trying.

Beer doesnt offer things which are written on the label. Its not honey and not bread :) Colour is crystal amber with thin head which disappears very quickly. Aroma is mainly malts maybe a little bread. Carbonation is much to high. Taste is medium sweet with poor bitterness.

Polish version of Foreign Extra Stout which actually resembles black IPA.
Aroma is coffe, dark chocolate, herbs, grass and some citrus - nice aroma from polish hops! Colour black with thick light brown head. Palate is oily with low carbonation. Taste is the complex of dark chocolate, medium-high bitterness and a little bit sourness. Its very nice beer, worth trying but it should be marked as a black ipa style.

Aroma is mainly spices with strong cardamon aroma and citrus from american hops. Taste is firstly a little sour, then bitter (as a mix of hop and spices - bitterness) and then its hot and spicy from... spices (ginger) :) overall is quite good but alcohol is to much felt.

Nice variation of pumpkin ale made with belgian yeast.
Pours dark brown with thin but creamy head. Aroma is a complex of fruits and bread with some roasty notes. Taste is firstly sweet, then sour. Beer is medium bodied with average carbonation. Generally worth trying beacuse of different interpretation of pumpkin ale style.

Aroma: malts (bread), butter, lemon
Appearance: amber color, thin but durable head, nice laycing
Taste: light sourness, medium biterness, later comes some sweetness
Carbonation is soft, its medium bodied with creamy texture
Generally nice ale, very drinkable, with nice aroma.
Aroma is mostly malts and honey. Nice head lasts long. Taste is sweet with low biterness, some herb flavours are also felt.its kind of not bad full bodied, sweet lager.

Aroma: tropical fruits, floral, banana and clove. Colour is deep amber, head is thick and ultra durable. Taste is great combination of australian hops, typical weizenbock flavours and high (for this beer style) bitterness. Sourness is medium. It has appropriate carbonaton. I recommend this beet because in my opinion the mix of australian hops and weizenbock flavours is great combination and gives very interesting results.

Aroma: citrus, cocoa, dark chocolate and rum (?).
Appearance: deep black, tanned and thin head.
Taste: mix of bitterness and sourness, its like citrus flavoured dark chocolate.
Palate: medium bodied and soft carbonated with long finish.
Its nice example of polish black IPA but for me there is a little bit to much malt aromas (dark chocolate) in relation to lack of american hops aroma.

Extremely easy drinking, session pils from Wasosz. Although its only 9 degrees Plato the taste is rich and full. Aroma is mainly hoppy and grass. I strongly recommended this lager especially during hot summer days.
Nice red ale with very strong hoppy aroma - citrus, pine and malts. Colour is red turning into deep amber. Biterness is medium. I recommend it as an easy drinking tasty beer.

Great version of Baltic Porter. Aroma is very rich: caramel, chocolate, coffee, herbs. Colour is deep black head is rocky and very durable. Taste is the mix of sweetness and biterness from hops and roasted malts. Its full bodied and creamy carbonation is soft. I strongly recommend this beer beacuse its great combination of well-known polish style and craft revolution ideas.
Aroma is mainly hoppy (citrus and pine) and malty. Head is nice but disappears quickly, its definitely to hazy. Taste is nice biterness is medium not long.
